revised_title: Extinct Lama Species Discovery in Quaternary Deposits of the Valley of Mexico
tldr: The author discusses the discovery of a large extinct lama species, Palauchenia magna, from Quaternary deposits in the Valley of Mexico. The remains were found associated with other extinct species, such as Mastodon. The author provides a detailed description of the fossil's teeth and cervical vertebrae, comparing them to those of existing and extinct camelids, and discusses the implications for understanding the evolution of these animals.
